document_data.name: Mantle
document_data.mainbody: The '''Mantle''' was a series of passages and side-caverns around the main cavern of [[Menzoberranzan]].

Description.The Eastways:
Within the Eastways were [[Ablonsheir's Cave]], named for [[Ablonsheir Ulu'ar]], a former [[archmage]] of Menzoberranzan, the [[Cavern of the Severed Tentacles]], named for a failed invasion of [[illithid]]s from [[Phanlinksal]], and the [[Pit-Warrens]], a jail for criminals and prisoners.

These tunnels led to [[Driders' Chasm]], the [[Fardrimm]] and the tunnels of fallen [[Delzoun]], which was claimed by [[dwarves]].
Description.The Masterways:
These tunnels were north of the [[Clawrift]]. As they did not lead to wide areas of the Underdark, the Masterways were considered a very safe spot in the otherwise perilous area. Several drow nobles use these passages for sport hunting.

Within the Masterways were the Cavern of the Masters where the wizards of [[House Xorlarrin]] and [[House Barrison Del'Armgo]] performed rituals to help [[Lolth]] in her creation of the [[Demon Weave]]. The Masters of [[Sorcere]] performed arcane experiments in the Masterways. The [[Glowstones]] were also in the Masterways, which acted as a meeting area with naturally luminescent rocks.
Description.The Wanderways: The Wanderways were the northeastern caverns of the Mantle. They were a winding arcane maze constructed by the archmage of Menzoberranzan.
Description.The Westways: These tunnels lead to [[Blingdenstone]], [[Mithral Hall]], [[Luruar]], [[Mantol-Derith]], and Phanlinksal. The Westways were often scouted and patrolled by drow forces. In these tunnels was the [[Lustrum]], an cavern filled with rich ore and [[gemstone]]s.
